intro: Desmazeria tuberculosa, commonly known as the roughleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and as a decorative plant in dry landscapes.
